title: Kris Marshall 'QUITS Death in Paradise after four years as Father Ted star Ardal O'Hanlon replaces him'
text:
Kris Marshall 'QUITS Death in Paradise after four years as Father Ted star Ardal O'Hanlon replaces him' It's said the actor is ready to move on Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kris Marshall's last series of Death in Paradise Share this video   
Death in Paradise actor Kris Marshall has reportedly quit the BBC series after four years - and his replacement is already being lined up. 
Although it's not yet known how his character Detective Inspector Humphrey Goodman will leave the show, it's said the hectic filming schedule in the Caribbean, away from his family, has prompted the move. 
"Despite shooting on one of the most glamorous locations on the planet, being apart from wife Hannah and their two young children for most of the six month filming schedule has proved too tough for Kris," a source told The Sun . Death in Paradise (Photo: BBC) Kris in Death in Paradise (Photo: BBC) 
“It’s been a hard decision, as he’s helped draw in huge figures since taking on the role, but after 17 years in the business he wants to spend more time with his family. That’s his priority now.” 
The 43-year-old actor joined the programme at the beginning of the third series, following the exit of Ben Miller. (Photo: BBC) 
It proved to be a success, and now Father Ted star Ardal O'Hanlon is in line to take the lead in the show's seventh series, with his first appearance coming on Wednesday night before filming for the next season begins over spring. 
Kris previously opened up about the pressures of Death in Paradise, and admitted he was worried about taking on the role. The new series of Father Ted stars Dermot Morgan as Father Ted and Ardal O'Hanlon and Father Dougall as young Dermot Morgan (Photo: Unknown) 
He said: "My one concern about taking this job was that I didn’t want to turn a show that gets nearly eight million viewers into a show that gets four million viewers. 
“That’s not going to look good for me.” Like us on Facebook
